summary: This is an email from January 21, 2010, discussing the 'Epstein Black Book' and a preliminary discovery conference with the attorney for Epstein's butler. The sender is providing relevant pages from the 'little black book' with handwritten notes attributed to the butler and seeking follow-up on the issue.

persons.name: AUSA in New York
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the email sender has not heard back from regarding the 'Epstein Black Book' issue.

persons.name: Butler
persons.context: Referred to as the 'butler' whose attorney the email sender is meeting with for a preliminary discovery conference. The butler's handwritten notes are in the provided 'little black book' pages.

connections.description: The butler is indirectly connected to the AUSA through the legal discovery process regarding the 'Epstein Black Book'.

events.title: Preliminary Discovery Conference with Butler's Attorney
events.description: The email sender is meeting with the attorney for Epstein's butler to conduct a preliminary discovery conference.

keyFacts: The 'Epstein Black Book' (referred to as the 'little black book') is a subject of legal discussion and discovery.
Handwritten notes within the black book are attributed to Epstein's butler.
A preliminary discovery conference is being held with the butler's attorney, indicating the butler's involvement in the legal proceedings.
The email is dated January 21, 2010, showing ongoing legal activity related to Epstein years after his 2008 plea deal.
